meanings.definition: The action of making the best or most effective use of a situation or resource.
meanings.sent1: The optimization of our time management skills helped us finish the project early.
meanings.sent2: She studied the optimization of the company's budget to reduce unnecessary expenses.
meanings.sent3: The optimization of the picnic blanket placement made the ants work harder for their snacks.
meanings.sent4: His optimization of the garden layout was like arranging puzzle pieces to fit perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The optimization of the traffic flow at the intersection made driving through it a breeze.

meanings.definition: The process of making something as fully perfect, functional, or effective as possible.
meanings.sent1: The optimization of the website's loading speed improved user experience.
meanings.sent2: They focused on the optimization of the new software to eliminate any bugs.
meanings.sent3: The optimization of the recipe made the cookies taste like a slice of heaven.
meanings.sent4: Her optimization of the workout routine transformed her fitness level in weeks.
meanings.sent5: The optimization of the study environment increased productivity and focus.
